queries.description: Containers should not run with allowPrivilegeEscalation in order to prevent them from gaining more privileges than their parent process

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{backend}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{backend-container}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{registry}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{registry-container}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{proxy}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{proxy-container}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{seaweedfs}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{seaweedfs-container}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{mongo}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{mongo-container}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{frontend}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{frontend-container}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false

queries.query_name: Volume Mount With OS Directory Write Permissions
queries.description: Containers can mount sensitive folders from the hosts, giving them potentially dangerous access to critical host configurations and binaries.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{registry}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{registry-container}}.volumeMounts.name={{registry-data}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true

queries.description: Containers should only run as non-root user. This limits the exploitability of security misconfigurations and restricts an attacker's possibilities in case of compromise

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{seaweedfs}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{seaweedfs-container}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{backend}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{backend-container}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{proxy}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{proxy-container}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{mongo}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{mongo-container}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{frontend}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{frontend-container}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{registry}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{registry-container}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true

queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.
Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities
The permission to create pods in a cluster should be restricted because it allows privilege escalation.

files.expected_value: metadata.name=backend-service-role.rules.verbs should not contain the value 'create' when metadata.name=backend-service-role.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=backend-service-role.rules.verbs contains the value 'create' and metadata.name=backend-service-role.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

queries.query_name: RBAC Roles with Read Secrets Permissions
queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with get/watch/list RBAC permissions on Kubernetes secrets are dangerous and should be avoided. In case of compromise, attackers could abuse these roles to access sensitive data, such as passwords, tokens and keys

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{backend-service-role}}.rules[0] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{backend-service-role}}.rules[0] is granted read access (verbs: create, get, list, watch, update, patch, delete) to Secrets objects

queries.description: Check if Readiness Probe is not configured.
Containers should be configured with a secure Seccomp profile to restrict potentially dangerous syscalls

queries.query_name: Service Account Token Automount Not Disabled
queries.description: Service Account Tokens are automatically mounted even if not necessary

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{proxy}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{seaweedfs}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{registry}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{frontend}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{mongo}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{backend}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false

queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles when binded, should not use get, list or watch as verbs

files.expected_value: The metadata.name={{backend-service-role}}.rules.verbs should not contain the following verbs: [["create", "get", "list", "watch", "update", "patch", "delete"]]

queries.description: Containers should be configured with an AppArmor profile to enforce fine-grained access control over low-level system resources

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{frontend}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{frontend-container}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{frontend}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{frontend-container}}
